benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid Request: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields with valid payload and required headers (204 on success).
Successful updates with optional headers (TC02, TC03).
Header validation and error handling: 400 responses for missing header (TC09), malformed body (TC08), empty body (TC10), and unsupported fields (TC11).
Invalid input handling: 400 for invalid invoiceItemId format (TC06).
Non-existing resources: 404 when item not found (TC07); state variation scenarios TC24/TC25 also yield 404 for missing items.
Large payload and size edge cases: TC12 (large payload with 204 or 413), TC21 (max size for single item).
Error handling spectrum: 500 (TC15), 504 (TC16), 503 (TC19) coverage via system error, timeout, and integration service unavailability.
Idempotency: TC17 verifies repeated PUTs yield 204 with consistent state.
Regression: TC18 ensures no data loss on updates.
Data integrity across variations: TC04/TC05 cover updates when prior custom fields exist or not.
Security: TC14 covers SQL injection attempts with 400/422 responses.
URL parameter handling: TC23 tests extra/unsupported URL parameters (204/400 depending on strictness).
State variation coverage: TC24/TC25 address DB-empty and partially populated scenarios.
gaps: Partial Update semantics for PUT vs PATCH are not explicitly tested (no explicit partial-update rule covered).
Concurrency/race condition testing for simultaneous updates to the same invoice item is not covered.
Duplicate submission scenarios beyond idempotency (not separately tested).
Data type validation beyond structural validation (e.g., numeric/string type boundaries) is not explicitly tested.
recommendations: Add concurrency/race-condition tests for simultaneous PUTs on the same invoice item.
Introduce rate-limiting tests and validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Add tests for duplicate submissions beyond idempotency guarantees, and deeper data-type validation (e.g., wrong types in CustomField values).
Clarify and test partial-update semantics (if PUT should support full replacement only, add tests to enforce that or add PATCH coverage if partial updates are allowed).
Expand malformed payload scenarios to include boundary cases and invalid content types (e.g., wrong Content-Type).
